result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Robert Albright was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael Robert Albright is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael Robert Albright was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to bring report from Doctor on November 2, 2015 Hearing.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Robert Albright

Hearing at 11-02-2015 04:30 pm

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Sharon Correll   DF ATTY:  Robert A Wertheimer   DF:  Michael Robert Albright appeared. Case called at 11:12 am. ADA Correll recites agreement. No objection from Atty Wertheimer. Court reviews constitutional rights with Def. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for count two with enhancer removed, Def pleads Guilty to Count two with enhancer removed. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates Def guilty of Count two with enhancer removed. Count one is dismissed without prejudice. Parties make sentencing arguements. Victim makes statement. Defendant makes statement. Court orders:
Court Costs $250.00
DNA Surcharge $200.00

scheduling order signed by EFV this date. c: DA & Atty. eif
Status conference on March 5, 2015 at 11:30 am.

Bond on file. 

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Colleen S.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.

CO: EFV, RPT: Elizabeth Frank, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Michael E. Nieskes,  DF ATTY:  Robert A Wertheimer,  DF:  Michael Robert Albright appeared.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial. Refund $250.00 to payor.  Status conference scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 11:30 am.
